item.title: Rails on Kubernetes - part 1: Setup
item.description: Rails on Kubernetes - part 1: Setup This is part one of a series of posts in which I’m going to walk through the process of deploying a Ruby on Rails application to Kubernetes. In this post, we’re going to use a one-node kubernetes cluster, running on your local development machine. One of the great things about kubernetes is that, from the point of view of your code, all clusters are the same.
